intro: Pleurostemon albus, commonly known as the white pleurostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in whorls along the stems. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks.
